global proc liquidContainer_assignNode (  string $  shortContainerName  ) 
 

global proc liquidContainer_assignToContainer (  string $  container  ) 
 

global proc int liquidContainer_export_doIt (  string $  shortContainerName,
string $  filePath,
string $  fileType
) 
 

Exports a given container node as a text file. It starts by checking if the file already exists. If it does, it will ask whether you want to overwrite it or not. If you do, the version number will be incremented and the old container moved to an archive directory.

Parameters:
$shortContainerName The name of the container node
$filePath The full path to the file
$fileType The filetype should be "*.lcf"
Returns:
true if successful. The file dialog won't close if true is not returned.

global proc liquidContainer_fileBrowser (  string $  mode,
string $  shortContainerName
) 
 

Opens a file browser to save a container file to disk.

global proc string [] liquidContainer_getContainerList (   ) 
 

global proc string liquidContainer_getHistoryDir (   ) 
 

creates a directory to store old container files so you can roll back.

Returns:
the dir path if successful, otherwise empty string.
Warning:
does not raise an error if directory creation fails, only a warning.

global proc string [] liquidContainer_getNodeList (  string $  shortContainerName  ) 
 

returns all members of the container ( short names only )

global proc int liquidContainer_import_sanityCheck (  string $  filePath  ) 
 

Checks if the LCF file has already been loaded.

Returns:
1 if the matching container already exists.
